Description:
A secluded, spacious and inspiring recipe for success
Drive directly in off Little Oxford Street to this sensational warehouse conversion that sates the appetite with its light-filled space, spectacular courtyard and superb kitchen which has been given the nod of approval by MoVidas' owner and acclaimed chef Frank Camorra. The exhilarating flavours of an enticing city-fringe lifestyle combine with imagination, precision and joie de vivre in this stunning 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. The historic Foy & Gibson precinct is synonymous with inner-Melbourne's best warehouse living and this secluded sanctuary at the heart of Collingwood is one of its most impressive. So, rev up the Vespa, cycle or walk as there's so much to explore right outside the door. Secure single-level access via intercom entrance and rear remote-control roller door with a wrought-iron gate provide an effortless entree to the light and airy interior staged over 2 easily-negotiated levels. Overlooking a vibrant alfresco terrace and lush vertical garden (automated irrigation), the ground-floor living and dining zone with high ceiling incorporates the main bedroom (WIR and ensuite), laundry and, with an award-winning celebrity chef in the family, a luxury designer kitchen boasting Smeg Victoria cooker, Miele dishwasher, plumbed coffee station, copious self-close storage and dream pantry. Up a short flight of stairs, the second level features free-flowing retreat and study areas, 2 further bedrooms, indulging bathroom with dual clawfoot baths plus walkway to the undercover car space. Including all the ingredients for inner-city success such as heating and cooling, storerooms/cellar, rich hardwood floors, LED lights, thick brick walls and original steel beams; this outstanding warehouse apartment is one to savour close to Smith/Gertrude Streets' cafes, restaurants and shops, galleries, trams, East Melbourne hospitals and Fitzroy Gardens.

Description:
Fairy Tale Ending!
One-On-One Inspections are available for this property at a time to best suit you and your schedule.
The Dream
This 1920 Californian bungalow could be a fairy tale ending for those who appreciate period properties. This ugly duckling is just marking time before someone turns it back into a beautiful swan. There are a multitude of original features just waiting to be restored to their former glory.The original brick and stone pillars create an imposing entrance to the porch and front door, which are complimented by the high front gable, with original timber shingles. This property will give you the house and lifestyle of a bygone era.
The Abode
Enter through the front door to a wide entrance hall with timber flooring that continues throughout this four bedroom house. Wander through the home and you will find spacious rooms, high ceilings, original baseboards and architraves, along with window hardware authentic to the period. The kitchen has an original range surround, along with exposed brick in the bathroom, and original fireplace in the living room. All the rooms are bright and sunny. This could definitely be turned into a warm and inviting family home. Set on a generous, flat block with many mature trees, you could just imagine watching your kids from the rear sun room, playing out on the lawn.
The Nearby
Moments to Fairfield Station, Station Street cafes and shopping, Yarra Bend Park and Fairfield Boathouse it promises lifestyle convenience that will prove irresistible.
Next Steps
Contact by email or call to book private inspection.
